Posts.Content: Jul 17, 2009 12:02AM Ihavehope wrote: I am on Herceptin and I get Muga scans every 3 months.  An echocardiogram is just as good.  With the radioactive isotope shortage, I would ensure you at least get an echocardiogram every 3 months.  Good luck.  The Herceptin is working well for me.  ; )

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2009 07:53PM Ihavehope wrote: Alaina, the reason why they can't use the port is because they don't have the training to use it.  I have asked my nuclear medicine department and because my cancer clinic is associated with it, I can ask the cancer clinic to send a nurse over to use the port for my muga scans.  It is a special way to attach the IV and then the port has to be flushed afterwards both of which require special training.  Ask the nuclear medicine department if there is some way you can get a nurse over to use the port and your oncologist for written permission.  That will be my plan once I get my port installed.  For now, I don't have any collapsed veins but they are tiny and hard to get the needles in them.  As for the runny nose, I had forgotten about that side effect.  How nice to have my hair back, even if there is a lot more and darker.  LOL
